Question: One parameter of the BLAST algorithm is a scoring threshold \(T\) (where "neighbor words" of a \(w\)-mer is defined as all sequences that align with the \(w\)-mer with a score of at least \(T\)). Lowering the \(T\) value would increase the _____, which would _____.
Option 1: false positive rate, sacrifice accuracy for speed
Option 2: false positive rate, sacrifice speed for accuracy
Option 3: false negative rate, sacrifice accuracy for speed
Option 4: false negative rate, sacrifice speed for accuracy

Question: When computing a best MSA using the bounded dynamic programming approach, which of the following would be an upper bound on the similarity score? If there are multiple correct answers, select the one that would be the tightest upper bound.
Option 1: The optimum alignment score of the best-scoring pair in the alignment
Option 2: The optimum alignment score of the worst-scoring pair in the alignment
Option 3: The sum of the optimum alignment scores of all pairs in the alignment
Option 4: The sum-of-pairs score of any arbitrary MSA.

Question: Consider the following three sequences. Suppose that we want to align them using the star alignment method. Assuming that all matches are treated the same, all mismatches are treated the same, and there are never any gaps, which sequence would be at the "center" of the star?
Preformatted:
Sequence 1: ATTCG
Sequence 2: ATACG
Sequence 3: ATTCC
Option 4: There is a tie, so the sequence would be selected arbitrarily.

Suppose that there exists a branching node in a de Bruijn graph of \(k\)-mers. What does this imply?
Option 1: There exists an Eulerian path in the equivalent graph of \((k-1)\)-mers.
Option 2: There does not exist an Eulerian path in the equivalent graph of \((k-1)\)-mers.
Option 3: There exists an Eulerian path in the equivalent graph of \((k+1)\)-mers.
Option 4: There does not exist an Eulerian path in the equivalent graph of \((k+1)\)-mers.
